Class HW1

  • java.lang.Object
    • HW1
  • class HW1
extends Object
    CSCI 333: Algorithms and Data Structures. Homework 1: Recursion. Implements two arrays of ordered integers, then uses the trinarySearch function to search for specified integers, testing a variety of use cases.
    Since:
    8/26/19
    Author:
    Jonathan Eatroff

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      HW1()  

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static int lowerThird​(int size)
      Shows the first index to divide a list into thirds The value must be shifted based on the array index at which the search begins
      static void main​(String[] args)
      Implements the arrays and searches for integers within them.
      static int trinarySearch​(int[] searchArray, int searchValue, int startIndex, int stopIndex)
      Performs a recursive trinary search for the earliest instance of a given integer in a list of integers Assumes the list is non-empty and ordered from smallest to largest
      static int upperThird​(int size)
      Shows the second index to divide a list into thirds The value must be shifted based on the array index at which the search begins

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(String[] args)
        Implements the arrays and searches for integers within them.
        Parameters:
        args - does nothing for purposes of this program

      • trinarySearch

        public static int trinarySearch​(int[] searchArray,
                                int searchValue,
                                int startIndex,
                                int stopIndex)
        Performs a recursive trinary search for the earliest instance of a given integer in a list of integers Assumes the list is non-empty and ordered from smallest to largest
        Parameters:
        searchArray - the total list of elements to be searched
        searchValue - the value to search for in the list
        startIndex - the index of the list in which to start searching
        stopIndex - the index of the list in which to stop searching
        Returns:
        the index at which the int was found, or -1 if it was not

      • lowerThird

        public static int lowerThird​(int size)
        Shows the first index to divide a list into thirds The value must be shifted based on the array index at which the search begins
        Parameters:
        size - the total number of elements in the list to be trinary searched
        Returns:
        the index to use as the border of the first and second thirds

      • upperThird

        public static int upperThird​(int size)
        Shows the second index to divide a list into thirds The value must be shifted based on the array index at which the search begins
        Parameters:
        size - the total number of elements in the list to be trinary searched
        Returns:
        the index to use as the border of the second and lasts thirds
